reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I have this PowerColor ITX RX 6400 for couple days now.I have a very old PC that has a i7-4790 and a GTX 745. The 745 won't cut it anymore. The 745 can run old games ok but newer games run like slide show. I am looking for the cheapest GPU I can find. The PowerColor RX-6400 is the cheapest and is available.I pulled out the 745 and plugged in this 6400. Downloaded the latest driver from AMD and started playing some of my games. The latest driver crashed Tomb Raider. So, I downloaded an older driver version. The game could run with the older version ok.This PowerColor fits nicely in my case. It runs fast and cold. Temperature is between 50 to 65C most of the time. The fan comes on only if there is a load. The 745 runs very hot around 75C when under load.This card has a HDMI and a DP ports. My motherboard also has a HDMI and a DP ports. I can have a total of 4 monitors plugged to my PC without any problem.The AMD Adrenalin app is pretty good. I can overlay the metrics on the screen to see the fps, fan speed, and other info while playing the games.The only thing I miss is the video encoder. I can use the HD 4600 in the i7 to encode but it is hit and miss. The Intel encoder driver does not like 2 GPUs in the PC. It crashes during encoding all the time. If I remove the RX 6400, I can encode with the iGPU without any problem. The HD 4600 is not as fast as the GTX 745 but it is much faster then using the i7 alone.Games run over 60 fps at 1080p now. Very old games run over 300 fps. I am happy with this PowerColor.I have some pictures.5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good budget card
reviews.reviewText: I got this product to upgrade a small form factor Dell I got on a liquidation sight to play some old pc games. It handles everything extremely well prior to 2016 without lag or screen tear. However, when running multiple tasks the gpu gets very hot and begin to run slow. The unit will get up to 85 Celsius and beyond which is above the rating for most thermal pastes that is used so I have to let it rest every once in a while. It was easy to install, I would recommend putting in with a pc with multiple fans. It came in a nice box and had a great sleek appearance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for an inexpensive card
reviews.reviewText: This card made a huge difference for me processing graphics in Photoshop, and especially using AI functions in Luminar Neo. 👍It was one of very few cards that would fit in my SFF case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked immediately with Linux.
reviews.reviewText: Just bought an older HP Xeon Workstation for cloud development, and just needed a cheap card for good dual monitor support. I'm running Fedora 38, I dropped the card in, booted up the machine, and worked like a charm without any further hassle. Obviously I don't game with the card, but full HD video on YouTube runs very smoothly. Excellent, inexpensive, practical purchase for a dev box.

reviews.reviewText: Works great for breathing life into an old pc. Especially something that doesn’t have a pcie cable on the psu (like an old optiplex)Easy install and download of drivers.Great for Small Form Factor builds

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A niche "upgrade" for an HP Pavilion Gaming PC
reviews.reviewText: My wife has a HP Pavilion 690-0010 PC. HP marketed this as a gaming PC. We all know better.I bought the Pavilion at the time for my wife to have access to the typical web browsing and email. She is not a gamer but on occasion she will play games with the family. Things like Overwatch 2 and Diablo 3.As with the other PCs in my household, I have done my best to upgrade this PC. Ove the years, I upgraded the RAM from 8GB to 16GB, added a WD Blue M.2 500GB SATA SSD and made this SSD the OS/app drive and now the stock WD Blue 1TB 7200RPM drive is a data drive. (I had to find my own M.2 screw. HP did not include one.) I even swapped out the stock Ryzen 3 2200G CPU with a Ryzen 5 2600 CPU. This was a neat upgrade. While on the original Ryzen 3 2200G, the PC did not qualify for Windows 11. After the CPU swap, the PC can now run Windows 11.With the PC being a small OEM box, upgrades are limited. The last wanting part to be replaced is the dedicated stock GPU which is a Radeon RX 550. I have been hoping that either Nvidia or AMD would release a newer non PCIE power required inexpensive GPU to replace the Raden RX 550.As an aside, my daughter has an HP Pavilion 790-0010 and about a year ago I replaced her stock GPU which was a 2GB GTX 1050 with an Asus Pheonix model GTX 1650. I was not able to get a second GTX 1650 at that time for my wife's PC and my daughter actively plays games more than my wife, so my daughter got the GTX 1650. The GTX 1650 upgraded the VRAM from 2GB to 4GB and made her PC VR ready. Though I take that with a grain of salt even though the Windows Mixed Reality Utility says she can do VR.Back to my wife's PC. I have been waiting for a GPU deal. So, I saw this PowerColor RX6400 come on sale. I knew that this was a severely nerfed GPU compared to even the RX 6500XT. Spec wise, it has a narrower memory bus and lacks video encoders. However, the RX6400 is more powerful than the RX550. Even with a narrower memory bus than the RX550 and only 4 PCE lanes in the PCIE connector, it still performs in my wife's HP PC which only has a PCIE 3.0 bus, about the same as the GTX 1650 in my daughter's PC.The RX6400 supports Raytracing. However, to be realistic, the 4GB VRAM is not enough memory for most Raytracing games to run and this GPU is still not that great compared to modern offerings in a similar price range. However, this was the only upgrade solution for my wife's PC, and it does provide more performance than she had.The card is 2 slots wide is full height and has a short length. Installation in her PC was easy. I did not have to do more than take the cover off the HP and swap GPU cards. For other upgrades, I had to move drive cages and things to get to the innards. The old GPU and this GPU were physically small enough that I had ample clearance to make the swap with only removing the case cover and opening the expansion card latch on the case. I did have to break out one of the metal slot covers on the case to fit the double wide card.The old RX550 had an HDMI output and a DVI output for video. The RX6400 has an HDMI output and DisplayPort output. I needed to use a DisplayPort to DVI converter so that I could still use my wife's monitor. Or I could have bought a new DisplayPort to DVI cable. So be mindful that you have the right cable or adapter on hand since the RX6400 lacks a DVI output.Once installed and powered up, I reinstalled the current AMD drivers without issue. I tried playing vides off YouTube and doing normal everyday tasks and I noticed no difference compared to the RX550. I mention this because this means my wife will not notice any detrimental difference compared to what the RX550 delivered.I also want to mention that this card has no video encoders. Not that my wife will try any streaming but that will not happen realistically on this card. No idea if the RX550 had video encoders.As did the RX550, this card is also quiet in the HP case, so it feels as though it is still a stock OEM card.I did run the Windows Mixed Reality Check tool, the SteamVR Performance TestTool. The WMR tool said my wife's PC is ready for WMR. The SteamVR tool indicated her PC is now Capable of SteamVR but recommended the RX6400 should be upgraded to be Ready for SteamVR. The result indicated some titles would work, others would not. This is better than the stock RX550 which could not pass either VR tool. To be clear, I do NOT recommend attempting VR on this GPU as it is still a low-end GPU.Lastly, I bought this PowerColor branded RX6400 during a promotion which netted me a free copy of The of Us Part 1. To get the game, you are emailed a coupon code which you need to redeem on AMDRewards.com. This triggers the download of the AMD Product Verification Tool and after it checks your coupon code, performs some sorcery, I was able to redeem the game on my Steam account once I linked my AMDRewards account to my Steam account. So I got a AAA first party title with my purchase that I was not expecting to get.The TLDR, this was a small upgrade that was imperceivable to my wife but at least gave her something more modern than what she had with a performance uplift that she will probably not realistically see. At least it should ensure GPU driver support going forward over what the RX550 will receive. This is a niche product that I bought at a marked down sale price, and I am happy for the game I received and the price I paid at the time of purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Card is a little beast
reviews.reviewText: I played Dirt 3 complete edition @ 1600x900 (900p) MSAA 2x, in High preset settings, i was getting average 85 fps. This card should be perfect to play 1080p games released before 2016. It's GDDR5 makes it a big difference with memory clock and the core clock can easily overclock at 900 mhz with keeping 68c at 70% fan speed using the latest AMD driver which was from 2021. I am impressed from its performance even though it's been bought for basic use rather then gaming but it is way better then the on board Intel gpu. Using Intel G4620 @ 3.7ghz and 8gb (2x4) DDR4 2133 cas 14 rams. I would give this card 10/10 for it's price and 4gb of GDDR5 vram.
Pas la performance attendu...ne roulais pas les jeux que je jouais avec une 1go

Tengo que decir, que honestamente esperaba menos y me dieron mas.La grafica en su momento de compra tuvo unos precios sumamente accesibles, siendo poco menos de 4,500 pesos mexicanos = 220 dólares (Al momento de compra, pero el precio subió ligeramente, ahorita esta en mas de 5k, así que cuidado, ya si aumenta a 6k no la recomiendo).Eso contando que era importación, el precio subió, pero para ser algo comprado así, el precio estaba mas que bien, me dio algo de miedo por las criticas a que bajaba rendimiento en PCIE 3.0, pero realmente con buenas configuraciones puedes hacer que casi todo corra en 60 fps estables en una calidad aceptable.Realmente me dio miedo, por ser mi primera compra de tan elevado precio, pero aun con todo ello la recomiendo totalmente, mas si es una opción para una PC que le falte algo de potencia y no quieras invertir mucho.Fuente de poder recomendada: 350 watts, con cualquiera que lo supere, ira perfecto, ya que no tiene para alimentación externa, y además, el ruido es mínimo, y sus temperaturas no son elevadas.Realmente vale la pena para mejorar un PC sin grafica a un precio accesible y sin gastos mayores, además con los Drivers de AMD facilita todo, su instalación es fácil y prácticamente es Plug and Play.Único detalle: No tiene tornillos incluidos, así que para asegurarla será algo difícil si no tienes tornillos aparte, te recomiendo tengas unos pequeños, aunque tampoco es que sea pesada, no te romperá el PC solo por no ponerle tornillos.

reviews.reviewTitle: Performs similar to rx 570, but way cheaper.
reviews.reviewText: Thus is by no means a good card. But if your desperate for a newer card this might be worth it.90+ fps in warframe on medium120+fps rocketleague on performance80+ fps in league of legends on medium.Struggles with dual monitor use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Prezzo esagerato in rapporto alle performance
reviews.reviewText: Non ho avuto modo di provarla personalmente in quanto la ho acquistata per errore, ma il prezzo di quwsta scheda è molto esagerato in rapporto alle sue perfomance
